overview_of_class: How do we perceive, remember, reason, and talk about the world? This course is an introduction to cognitive psychology, covering topics such as perception, attention, memory, knowledge representation, language, reasoning, problem solving, judgment, and decision-making. Classes consist of lectures, in-class demonstrations, and discussion. Students learn to think critically about the assumptions and methods underlying research in cognition. Students achieve an overview of topics in cognition, read original empirical research papers, and participate in demonstrations of experiments.
